column4: Hello all, im starting in the computer security field and im trying to execute a buffer overflow in a program "i made the app my self" and i turned off stack randomization in the OS and compiled with gcc with the -fno-stack-protector flag but no matter what i do i cant overwrite the eip pointer
is there some other stack protection i need to disable?
-> perhaps get an older kernel that has a known issues, newer ones are patched
-> umm why not try it againts older kernels? you may have better luck with the older ones..like 2.6.11 perhaps..
